spec.name: Lalla Taja Mausoleum
spec.description:
ðŸ”» Date: Early 20th Century
ðŸ”» Comments:Â  This mausoleum, the sole one dedicated to a woman in Casablanca's Medina, honors Lalla Taja, a revered figure known for her care of orphans and support for single mothers.
Recognized for her benevolence, she received assistance from the Belgian consulate.
Following her passing, the women of the Medina, who esteemed her deeply, came together to bury her and erect this mausoleum in her honor. Lalla Taja remains a cherished symbol for the women of Casablanca's Medina.
